title: Paul Pierce said Jayson Tatum’s injury ‘made it easier’ for Celtics to move Holiday, Porzingis
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Paul Pierce commented that Jayson Tatum's injury facilitated the Celtics' decision to trade Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis.
The Celtics traded Porzingis to the Hawks and Holiday to the Trail Blazers to manage the NBA's luxury tax implications.
With Tatum sidelined, the Celtics retain Jaylen Brown, Derrick White, and Payton Pritchard, with playoff contention uncertain.

title: MassGOP to pay $36K after allegations of illegal donations
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: The Massachusetts Republican Party will pay $36,000 to settle allegations of receiving illegal donations in 2022.
A $27,723.45 donation from Dean Tran's congressional campaign was cited as coming from a prohibited federal source.
Current party chair Amy Carnevale cited "sloppy accounting practices" for the improper contributions identified by OCPF.

title: 2 mountain towns in New England are affordable and ‘full of adventure’ this winter
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: TravelAwaits lists North Conway, NH, and Ludlow, VT, as affordable winter adventure destinations in New England.
North Conway offers 1,600 skiable acres, snowshoeing, and cross-country skiing including popular spots like Attitash and Wildcat Mountain.
Ludlow features Okemo Mountain Resort with skiing, a tubing park, ice skating rink, and trails around Okemo Valley.

title: Officials: Charlie Kirk’s killer blended in on campus; high-powered rifle recovered
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Charlie Kirk was shot and killed by a sniper from a distant rooftop at Utah Valley University campus.
The shooter, believed to be of college age, used a high-powered rifle and fled into a nearby neighborhood.
The assassination was labeled a political event with bipartisan condemnation, and Vice President JD Vance plans to visit Kirk's family.

title: ‘Laughable’: College football analyst’s blunt take on Bill Belichick’s start at UNC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Bill Belichick begins his UNC coaching career with a loss to TCU and a win against UNC Charlotte.
Belichick bans New England Patriots scouts from UNC, stating reciprocal unwelcome feelings towards the Patriots' facility.
ESPN's Paul Finebaum criticizes Belichick's decisions and early performance, calling his start at UNC 'laughable.'

title: This Mass. woman just placed 2nd on NBC’s ‘American Ninja Warrior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Addy Herman from Pembroke placed 2nd in the 2025 'American Ninja Warrior: Women's Championship.'
Noah Meunier from Fairhaven, Herman's boyfriend, also placed 2nd in the regular season of NBC's 'American Ninja Warrior.'
Herman and Meunier train at Fall River's Vitality Obstacle Fitness, and have recently set a world record for a mixed pair obstacle course.

title: 5 can’t-miss restaurant openings and dining updates in Boston this week
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Capricho Colombian Steakhouse to open September 2025 in Brookline, offering wood-grilled meats and live music.
Elephantine Bakery expands from Portsmouth to Seaport with a menu of French-Mediterranean pastries and cakes.
Eastern Standard hosts Pickle Week with events including game day specials and a patio pickle party this weekend.

title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis, a Bruins prospect, impressed with 12 points in six AHL games, following a strong 2025 IIHF performance.
Locmelis scored four goals over seven games playing for Latvia during the World Championships, drawing praise from Sidney Crosby.
Coach Ryan Mougenel highlights Locmelis' quick adaptation to AHL's physicality and potential impact during the upcoming training camp.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye's performance as timid during the season-opening loss to the Raiders.
Maye completed 14-of-20 passes for 150 yards and a touchdown but struggled in the second half, including an interception.
New England's special teams and defense also faltered, allowing nine plays of 20+ yards to Raiders QB Geno Smith.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, from Braintree, died from injuries after being hit by an e-bike in Copley Square on August 6.
The incident occurred near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street in front of the Boston Public Library.
The e-bike operator remained at the scene; no charges have been filed by the Boston police.
